ENGLISH: Modern guns are small (generally 76mm) but effective weapons with radar-control, fast fire rate, and long range.
WW2 era heavy naval guns between 330 and 406mm calibers.
CIWS stands for Close-In Weapon System and provides the last bastion of ship defense. Their main armaments are 20-30mm multibarrelled Gatling guns.
Long range, supersonic speed anti-ship missiles fired from tube or vertical launch systems.
Medium range, supersonic speed anti-ship missiles fired from tube or vertical launch systems.
Long range anti-ship missiles fired from angled tube or box launch systems.
Rocket propelled anti-submarine torpedoes fired from vertical or box launch systems.
Ship based helicopters providing ASW, rescue, or anti-ship capability.
Short-range anti-air missiles used for close range/point defense.
Medium range anti-air missiles used for fleet/battle group defense.
Carrier based multi-role fighters capable of performing air-superiority, anti-ship, and strike missions.
Carrier based air superiority fighters primarly for defending the carrier battle group.
TLAM missiles used for attacking land based targets like buildings and HQs
